jparsec.astronomy

Class VisualLimit

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astronomy.VisualLimit

  • public class VisualLimit
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates sky brightness and limiting magnitude.
    Based on C code by Bill Gray (www.projectpluto.com), which was in turn based on Brad Schaefer's article and code on pages 57-60, May 1998 Sky & Telescope, "To the Visual Limits".

    The computations for sky brightness and limiting magnitude can be broken up into several pieces. Some computations depend on things that are constant for a given observing site and time: the lunar and solar zenith distances, the air masses to those objects, the temperature and relative humidity, and so forth.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    M. Huss, T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Constructor Detail

      • VisualLimit

        public VisualLimit()
        Default constructor.

      • VisualLimit

        public VisualLimit(int bandMask,
           jparsec.astronomy.VisualLimitFixedBrightnessData fbd,
           jparsec.astronomy.VisualLimitAngularBrightnessData abd)
        Explicit (all values) constructor.
        Parameters:
        bandMask - A logical mask which represents one or more of the five possible bands to calculate. Bands are U (1), B (2), V (4), R (8), and I (16), so to calculate all set this value to 31, the sum of all them.
        fbd - The fixed brightness data.
        abd - The angular brightness data.

      • getLimitingMagnitude

        public static double getLimitingMagnitude(TimeElement time,
                          ObserverElement obs,
                          EphemElement ephem_sun,
                          EphemElement ephem_moon,
                          double azimuth,
                          double elevation)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Computes limiting magnitude for V band.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        ephem_sun - Ephem object containing Sun's ephemeris.
        ephem_moon - Ephem object containing Moon's ephemeris.
        azimuth - Azimuth of observing point in radians.
        elevation - Elevation of observing point in radians.
        Returns:
        Limiting magnitude.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the observer is not located on Earth.

      • getSkyBrightness

        public static double[] getSkyBrightness(TimeElement time,
                        ObserverElement obs,
                        EphemElement ephem_sun,
                        EphemElement ephem_moon,
                        double azimuth,
                        double elevation)
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Computes sky brightness for U, B, V, R, and I bands.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        ephem_sun - Ephem object containing Sun's ephemeris.
        ephem_moon - Ephem object containing Moon's ephemeris.
        azimuth - Azimuth of observing point.
        elevation - Elevation of observing point.
        Returns:
        Sky brightness values in nanolamberts (nL).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the band index is not valid or the observer is not on Earth.

      • isVisibleToNakedEye

        public static boolean isVisibleToNakedEye(TimeElement time,
                          ObserverElement obs,
                          EphemerisElement eph,
                          EphemElement ephem)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Computes if the object is visible to the naked eye or not. Position of the object is calculated using Moshier ephemeris.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        ephem - Ephem object with the ephemeris calculations.
        Returns:
        True if it is visible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the observer is not on Earth or the calculation fails.

        azimuth - Azimuth of observing point.
        elevation - Elevation of observing point.
        Returns:
        Extinction coefficients.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the band index is not valid or the observer is not on Earth.
